title: Old-Fashioned Shortcake Recipe
description: This recipe for shortcake is easy to make and bakes up golden and tender — just waiting to be filled with cream and topped with summer strawberries!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Shortcake Recipes Old-Fashioned Shortcake 4.6 (126) 113 Reviews 18 Photos This easy recipe for shortcake was given to me by a friend. It was her mother's recipe, and it has become one of my favorite summer dessert recipes. These fabulous cakes sop up all the strawberry juices, and the touch of nutmeg sends them over the top! Submitted by Jennifer Kuchnicki Merzlicker Updated on April 16, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 18 18 18 18 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 (8-inch) shortcake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 cups all-purpose flour 1 cup white sugar 4 teaspoons baking powder ½ teaspoon salt ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg (Optional) ½ cup cold butter, cubed ⅓ cup milk 1 large egg Directions Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Grease an 8-inch baking pan. Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg together in a large bowl. Cut in butter with 2 knives or a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Beat together milk and egg in a small bowl; stir into flour mixture until batter is just blended. Spread batter in the prepared baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about 15 minutes. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack. I Made It Print 237 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Old-Fashioned Shortcake 01 of 18 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 18 Photo by  CindyM 04/11/2025 Definitely use 2/3 cups of milk…I used skim milk. I also skipped the nutmeg and added a tsp of pure vanilla (with the egg & milk). I used a 9” round pan and cooked at 350 for 30 minutes. Tasted great! 03 of 18 Photo by  TrendyYolk7721 05/12/2024 A keeper! Crowd-pleaser Great flavors Easy to follow 04 of 18 Photo by  Dianne Montgomery Hocut 05/09/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser This recipe was wonderful! I followed it exactly except I baked this in three small round pans. It was done in 15 minutes and had a wonderful shortbread texture like a sweet biscuit almost. I topped it with freshly cut and sweetened strawberries and homemade whipped cream. Deliciousness in no time!! 05 of 18 Photo by  BoldLamb8776 09/14/2022 Very easy to follow and make. I only did half the recipe and it came out great 06 of 18 Photo by  FlimsyTea8455 09/09/2022 This is a true shortbread- I did adjust slightly. It is not pourable so you press lightly into pan. I did double the recipe and it turned out beautiful. I also cooked at 450 degrees for about 7 minutes and then cooked for another 13 to 15 at 400 degrees because it was a bit giggly when I wet to take it out of the oven at the recommended time of 15 minutes. - I also sprinkles sugar on top prior to baking. For elevation purposes ... I live in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado so that could be the reason for temp and cook time adjustment. 07 of 18 Photo by  quiltingmama 04/30/2022 I had some angst about this recipe from reading all the reviews. But this shortcake is delicious!!!!!I felt it was a little dry when I was going to put it in my pan so I added 1tsp of vanilla, that wasn’t enough, so I added a dash more milk.I also debated back and forth while prepping bake at 350 or 450??? Decided to try it as written at 15 minutes it was a beautiful golden brown. And hubby loved it!This is actually the first shortcake in the years of our marriage that turn out perfect and tasted so good!
